meanings.definition: Causing or showing a fondness for causing trouble in a playful way.
meanings.sent1: The mischievousness puppy chewed on my shoe.
meanings.sent2: Her mischievousness grin gave away her prankster nature.
meanings.sent3: The mischievousness squirrel stole all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The mischievousness wind whispered secrets through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The mischievousness child left a trail of toys in their wake.

meanings.definition: The quality or state of being mischievous.
meanings.sent1: His mischievousness was evident in the twinkle of his eye.
meanings.sent2: The mischievousness of the cat was evident in its playful pouncing.
meanings.sent3: The mischievousness of the situation made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The mischievousness of the river's twists and turns kept us on our toes.
meanings.sent5: The mischievousness of the jester entertained the royal court.
